definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
the entire nation/the whole country, from the leadership to the rank and file

sentences.english: He died in 1892, his death being considered as a national calamity.
sentences.chinese: 他死于1892年，他的逝世被认为是举国的不幸。

sentences.english: Chiang dynasty China on behalf of, the whole country to celebrate people to stand.

sentences.english: The entire country is behind Qi，and the home-Sheng everything.
sentences.chinese: 举国上下齐欢畅，家和国盛万事兴。

sentences.english: Autumn in October, the national flag fluttering, national jubilation.
sentences.chinese: 金秋十月，国旗招展，举国同庆。

sentences.english: On hearing of the victory , the nation was transported with joy.
sentences.chinese: 听到胜利的消息，举国上下一片欢腾。

sentences.english: The paper expatiates on the concept of our national competitive sports system.
sentences.chinese: 主要通过对竞技体育举国体制基本概念的梳理。

The entire country is behind Qi， and the home-Sheng everything.

sentences.english: Fenghuang Ancient Town or literally translated into Phoenix Ancient Town is a national-level famous town for its history and culture.
sentences.chinese: 凤凰古镇以其历史和文化举国闻名。

sentences.english: The whole nation is looking at the team now - but do you like that?
sentences.chinese: 当前举国上下都在关注国家队，你怎么看？

sentences.english: We should stick to the Whole-nation System.
sentences.chinese: 指出必须坚定不移地坚持举国体制。

sentences.english: Back-to-Front Day has been celebrated today throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 今天举国上下欢庆颠倒日。

sentences.english: When that great man died, the whole country keened him.
sentences.chinese: 当那位伟人去世的时候，举国为其恸哭。

sentences.english: In the United States this weekend is one for celebrating.
sentences.chinese: 这个周末的美国将是一派举国欢腾的场面。

sentences.english: It comes to the capital of China. We enjoy the technological Olympics all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 终于，它来到中国的首都，举国欢庆，科技奥运。

sentences.english: There is solid unity throughout the nation.

definition: the entire nation/the whole country, from the leadership to the rank and file
all levels of society/the imperial court and the ordinary people

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
